jwt.title: JWT Inspector - Dev Toolbox
jwt.description: Decode and inspect JSON Web Tokens (JWT) locally in your browser. View header, payload, check expiration, and more. No data sent to servers.
jwt.heading: JWT Inspector
jwt.subtitle: Decode and inspect JSON Web Tokens locally. Your tokens never leave your browser. View header, payload, check expiration status, and understand your JWTs.
jwt.shareWarning: âš ï¸ Sharing URLs may expose tokens in browser history and server logs.
jwt.pasteToDecode: Paste a JWT to decode it
jwt.jwtDescription: A JSON Web Token (JWT) is a compact, URL-safe means of representing claims to be transferred between two parties. JWTs consist of three parts separated by dots: header, payload, and signature.
jwt.privacyText: This tool processes JWTs entirely in your browser. No data is sent to any server. Your tokens remain private and secure.

cron.title: Cron Explainer & Simulator â€“ Dev Toolbox
cron.description: Explain cron expressions in plain English and preview upcoming run times in your timezone.
cron.heading: Cron Explainer & Simulator
cron.subtitle: Explain cron expressions in plain English and preview upcoming execution times. This tool supports standard Linux-style 5-field cron syntax commonly used in servers and cloud schedulers.
cron.format: Format: minute hour day-of-month month day-of-week
cron.cronDescription: A cron expression is a string used to define a schedule for running tasks automatically. It consists of 5 fields that specify when a task should execute: minute, hour, day of month, month, and day of week.
cron.privacyText: This tool processes cron expressions entirely in your browser. No data is sent to any server.
cron.enterCronExpression: Enter a cron expression to see explanation

timestamp.title: Timestamp Converter â€“ Dev Toolbox
timestamp.description: Convert Unix timestamps, ISO dates, and milliseconds. Preview in local time or UTC instantly.
timestamp.heading: Timestamp Converter
timestamp.subtitle: Convert between Unix timestamps, ISO 8601 dates, and human-readable formats. All conversions happen instantly in your browser.
timestamp.unixTimestampDescription: A Unix timestamp is the number of seconds (or milliseconds) that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC. This epoch-based system is widely used in programming, databases, and APIs.
timestamp.secondsDescription: 10 digits (e.g., 1734540000). Common in Unix systems and most APIs.
timestamp.millisecondsDescription: 13 digits (e.g., 1734540000000). Used by JavaScript, Java, and some databases.
timestamp.useCase1: Debugging API responses and log files
timestamp.privacyText: This tool processes timestamps entirely in your browser. No data is sent to any server.
timestamp.enterTimestamp: Enter a timestamp or select a date/time

request.title: API Request Builder â€“ Dev Toolbox
request.description: Build API requests and generate curl, fetch, and axios snippets instantly. Works locally, no tracking.
request.heading: API Request Builder
request.subtitle: Build HTTP requests visually and generate code snippets for curl, fetch, and axios. All processing happens locally in your browser.
request.enterUrl: Enter a URL to generate code
request.aboutDescription: This tool helps you build HTTP requests and generate code snippets for different HTTP clients. Whether you're debugging an API, documenting integrations, or sharing reproducible requests with teammates, this builder saves time.
request.fetchDescription: Native browser/Node.js API with TypeScript types
request.axiosDescription: Popular HTTP client with rich features
request.privacyText: This tool runs entirely in your browser. No requests are sent, no data is stored on any server. Your API keys and tokens stay private.

json.title: JSON Formatter & Inspector â€“ Dev Toolbox
json.description: Prettify, minify, validate, and inspect JSON locally. Search keys/values and copy clean output instantly.
json.heading: JSON Formatter & Inspector
json.subtitle: Format, validate, and inspect JSON with a visual tree view. Search for keys and values instantly. All processing happens locally in your browser.
json.largeJsonWarning: âš ï¸ Large JSON detected (> 2MB). Processing may be slow.
json.enterValidJson: Enter valid JSON to see output
json.aboutDescription: This tool helps you work with JSON data quickly and efficiently. Whether you're debugging API responses, editing configuration files, or inspecting logs, the JSON Formatter has you covered.
json.featureMinify: Compress JSON to a single line
json.featureValidate: Check JSON syntax with detailed error messages
json.featureTreeView: Navigate large JSON with collapsible nodes
json.tip1: Click on a key in the tree view to copy its JSONPath
json.tip2: Use the search box to filter the tree and highlight matches
json.tip3: Enable "Sort keys" for consistent output when comparing JSON
json.privacyText: This tool runs entirely in your browser. No JSON data is sent to any server. Your data stays private.

base64.title: Base64 Converter - Dev Toolbox
base64.description: Encode and decode Base64, Base64URL, and Hex locally. UTF-8 safe. Convert between variants and copy results instantly.
base64.heading: Base64 Converter
base64.subtitle: Encode and decode Base64, Base64URL, and Hex formats. UTF-8 safe encoding. All conversions happen locally in your browser.
base64.pasteText: Paste text, Base64, Base64URL, or Hex...
base64.strictModeDesc: Strict mode: Rejects whitespace/newlines in encoded inputs, requires even-length hex, and disallows 0x prefix.
base64.enterInput: Enter input to see decoded text
base64.aboutDescription: This tool helps you encode and decode data between different formats: plain text, Base64, Base64URL, and hexadecimal. All conversions happen locally in your browser â€” no data is sent to any server.
base64.formatText: Plain UTF-8 text (supports Unicode, emoji, etc.)
base64.base64vsDescription: Base64URL is a variant of Base64 designed for use in URLs and filenames:
base64.privacyText: This tool runs entirely in your browser. No data is sent to any server. Your data stays private.

url.title: URL Inspector & Builder â€“ Dev Toolbox
url.description: Parse, inspect, and build URLs. Edit query parameters, encode values, and copy clean URLs instantly.
url.heading: URL Inspector & Builder
url.subtitle: Parse URLs into components, view and edit query parameters, encode/decode URL parts, and rebuild the final URL. All processing happens locally in your browser.
url.noQueryParams: No query parameters. Click "Add" to create one.
url.parseUrlToSeeParams: Parse a URL to see its query parameters
url.encodingHelperDescription: Use the % and A buttons on each parameter to encode or decode its value.
url.aboutDescription: Inspect and build URLs locally. Parse components, edit query parameters, and copy clean URLs for APIs and debugging. No data leaves your browser.
url.featureLiveParsing: URLs are parsed as you type
url.urlEncodingDescription: Special characters in URLs must be percent-encoded:
url.privacyText: This tool runs entirely in your browser. No data is sent to any server. Your data stays private.

about.title: About - Dev Toolbox
about.description: About Anton Bulavenko, the maker of Dev Toolbox.
about.heading: About
about.intro: I'm Anton Bulavenko, a frontend engineer building fast, privacy-first tools for developers.
about.philosophy: I care about performance, user experience, and practical software that respects users.
about.devToolbox: Dev Toolbox is built with this philosophy: useful tools that work locally, don't track you, and just get the job done.

privacy.title: Privacy - Dev Toolbox
privacy.description: Privacy policy for Dev Toolbox. We don't collect, store, or transmit any data.
privacy.heading: Privacy

noDataCollection.title: No Data Collection
noDataCollection.text: Dev Toolbox does not collect, store, or transmit any data to external servers. All processing happens locally in your browser.

localStorage.title: Local Storage
localStorage.text: The JWT Inspector uses your browser's localStorage to save your preferences and history. This data never leaves your device. You can clear it at any time from the tool interface or by clearing your browser data.

noAnalytics.title: No Analytics
noAnalytics.text: We don't use any analytics, tracking pixels, or third-party scripts. No cookies are set except for essential functionality.

noBackend.title: No Backend
noBackend.text: This is a static website. There is no server processing your requests. All tool logic runs entirely in JavaScript within your browser.

shareLinks.title: Share Links
shareLinks.text: When you enable "Share Link" for the JWT Inspector, the token is added to the URL. Be aware that shared URLs may be logged in browser history, server logs, and analytics tools of whoever receives the link.

openSource.title: Open Source
openSource.text: The source code is available for review. You can verify these privacy claims by inspecting the code yourself.

privacy.tldr: Your data stays on your device. We don't see it, store it, or sell it.
